title: Is it right to study from the NCERT book? - Quora
tags: National Council of Educational Research and Training (NCERT)

response.answer_text: ABSOLUTELY! I mean, why would it 'NOT' be right to read from any book? Hi there! Reading from the question, seems like you're confused as to whether you should be referring to NCERT textbooks for your examinations or not. See, the answer to this question is very clear, “YOU SHOULD!”. I reckon that you're in CBSE because that's when one follows NCERT, take it from my experience that CBSE question pattern for boards or even in internals are solely based on NCERT textbooks. You should not even have second thoughts about NOT reading it. If you want to read other publications for any subject, feel free to do so but before that or even after, make sure that you open your NCERT textbooks and read through them. You should not ignore a single concept jotted down in your NCERT textbooks because every word of those textbooks are important. Now, I guess I've scared you enough. But take it as an advice and nothing more or less. Also, if you're looking to buy NCERT textbooks then check out the website MyPustak. You can get them for the cheapest price at that website. I hope I was able to help you out in some way. Thank you.

NCERT is completely good to refer for any exams including Boards, Neet, JEE, UPSC and all. NCERT is just like God gifted book for all students it helps a lot for the preparation. Through NCERT you can clear all your concepts with all complete derivation of formula and all the important diagrams so don't bad at all even you can practice on examples as well. Why NCERTs are important ? Simple: The language in NCERT Books are highly simplified for your better understanding.Extensive Research: NCERT books are written & published after a great amount of research has been done by reputed people in the field.Authentic: NCERT books are an authentic source of information as the information published is provided by government agencies & institutions.Standard book for all exams: They are standard books for all exams & questions therein are also reliable.Correct information: NCERT books are checked and rechecked many times before they are published, so the information is correct.Good for understanding concepts: These books cover topics in a well framed manner. They start with the basics and go on to a higher level, unlike many other books. So, you are looking to clear your concepts NCERT is the way to go.Also, you can find any NCERT books( class 5 to class 12 ) with a solution on Toppr website / Application just search on google you will get free PDF for each and every book so just go and check out. I hope my answer helps you. Thank you 👍 ALL THE BEST!!
